name: NSDictionaryController
desc: A bindings-compatible controller that manages the display and editing of a dictionary of key-value pairs.

items.name: func newObject() -> NSDictionaryControllerKeyValuePair
items.desc: Creates and returns a new key-value pair to represent an entry in the content dictionary.

items.name: var localizedKeyDictionary: [String : String]
items.desc: The localized key names that are displayed by the receiver in place of the key names.

items.name: var localizedKeyTable: String?
items.desc: the strings file used to localize key names.

items.name: var includedKeys: [String]
items.desc: The key names that are represented by a key-value pair, even if they are not present in the receiverâ€™s content dictionary.

items.name: var excludedKeys: [String]
items.desc: The key names that are never displayed in the user interface items bound to the receiver.

items.name: var initialKey: String
items.desc: The string used as the initial key name for a newly inserted item.

items.name: var initialValue: Any
items.desc: The string used as the initial value for a newly inserted item.
